title: (x) abstract/techno fonts - custom designed by Rinzen {Dav}
content:
I wasn't sure what to name the thread for Im not sure what this style is really called. Anyhow, do you guys have any ideas as to what types these might be? (see attached)

Also, where can I find some really nice abstact fonts. I've been to T.26, Identikal, DesignerShock, Maniackers Design - with some luck but not like the attached.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitled-1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062238/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_3.gif) | 8.58 KB |
author: elabdesigns

comments.content:
Custom type design by [Rinzen](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062238/http:/www.rinzen.com/).  
_( Maybe thats why it says 'Rinzen', in the sample. :)_

Dav

_( Edit-A-Bit: You may be able find some more sites / foundries featuring such types at ' [The TypeDesign.eu Directory](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062238/http:/www.typedesign.eu/directory)'. :)_

Check also DS Lane in [DS4.Sale](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062238/http:/www.ds4sale.com/) and [Virna](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062238/http:/www.fsd.it/fonts/virna.htm) of [Fabrizio Schiavi fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20110809062238/http:/www.fsd.it/fonts/index.htm).
